TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable PeerNearMe extends System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.Peer implements class System.IEquatable`1<class System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe>, class System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable

Docs.summary: Represents a peer located by the "People Near Me" infrastructure.

remarks.format:
## Remarks An instance of this class cannot be created directly. Instead, a reference to the peers "near" the calling peer is obtained by using the static <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerCollaboration.GetPeersNearMe%2A> method to return a collection of nearby peers.
A peer represented by a PeerNearMe object is not necessarily in the calling peer's address book.

MemberSignature.Value: protected void InternalRefreshData (object state);
.method familyorassemblyhidebysig instance void InternalRefreshData(object state) cil managed

Docs.param: Specifies the application, object, and presence data relevant to a instance.
Docs.summary: Initiates a network operation to retrieve the application, object and presence data specific to a instance.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The data retrieved is stored in a cache accessed by the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.GetApplications%2A> and <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.GetObjects%2A> methods as well as the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerPresenceInfo.PresenceStatus%2A> property. The InternalRefreshData method only needs to be used if the caller is not subscribed to the specified <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.Peer>, <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe>, or <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact>.
This method blocks additional calls until the network operation is complete and the cache has been updated.
The caller is not required to sign in with the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerCollaboration.SignIn%2A> method or via a user interface in to complete this operation successfully.

Docs.summary: Sends an invitation to join a peer collaboration application to a remote peer.
Docs.returns: object containing the relevant value specified by the remote peer.
Docs.exception:
- The associated with the specified by the is or has a value count of '0' associated endpoints.
- A <xref:System.Guid> has not been associated with the current peer-to-peer application.

MemberSignature.Value: public override System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerInvitationResponse Invite (System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication applicationToInvite, string message, byte[] invitationData);

.method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerInvitationResponse Invite(class System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication applicationToInvite, string message, unsigned int8[] invitationData) cil managed

Docs.param: Specifies the relevant Peer Collaboration application represented by a instance.
A message to send to the remote peer along with the application invitation. The message can be no more than 255 Unicode characters.
A user defined data blob to associate with the invitation. Size is limited to 16K (16,384 bytes).
Docs.summary: Sends an invitation to join a peer collaboration application to a remote peer that includes data that describes or specifies the application invite.
Docs.returns: object containing the relevant value specified by the remote peer.
Docs.exception:
- The argument specifies an empty <xref:System.Guid>.
- The associated with the specified by the is or has a value count of '0' associated endpoints.

.method public hidebysig virtual instance void InviteAsync(object userToken) cil managed

Docs.param: User-defined object passed to the callback of the asynchronous operation for identification. This required parameter must be unique across all asynchronous invitation operations still in-progress.
Docs.summary: Receives an invitation response from a peer regarding joining a peer collaboration application.
Docs.exception: This object does not specify a valid <xref:System.Guid>.

A message to send to the remote peer along with the application invitation. The message can be no more than 255 Unicode characters.
A user defined data blob to associate with the invitation. Size is limited to 16K.
User-defined object passed to the callback of the asynchronous operation for identification. This required parameter must be unique across all asynchronous invitation operations still in-progress.
Docs.summary: Receives an invitation response from a peer regarding an invitation to a peer collaboration application.
Docs.exception:
- The endpoint specified by was not found.
- The argument specifies an empty <xref:System.Guid>.

MemberSignature.Value: protected void OnRefreshDataCompleted (System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.RefreshDataCompletedEventArgs e);
.method familyhidebysig instance void OnRefreshDataCompleted(class System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.RefreshDataCompletedEventArgs e) cil managed

Docs.param: Event data contained in a instance.
Docs.summary: Signals the event.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Classes that inherit from this class can override this method to perform additional tasks when the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe.RefreshDataCompleted> event occurs.
This method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

MemberSignature.Value: public void RefreshData ();
.method public hidebysig instance void RefreshData() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initiates a network operation to retrieve the application, object and presence data specific to a instance.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The data retrieved is stored in a cache accessed by the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.GetApplications%2A> and <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.GetObjects%2A> methods as well as the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerPresenceInfo.PresenceStatus%2A> property. This method only needs to be used if the caller is not subscribed to the specified <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.Peer>, <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe>, or <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact>.
This method blocks additional calls until the network operation is complete and cache has been updated.
The caller is not required to sign in with the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerCollaboration.SignIn%2A> method or via a user interface in to complete this operation successfully.

MemberSignature.Value: public void RefreshDataAsync (object userToken);
.method public hidebysig instance void RefreshDataAsync(object userToken) cil managed

Docs.param: User-specified state object that is passed to the delegate when this method completes the operation.
Docs.summary: Initiates a network operation to retrieve the application, object and presence data specific to a instance.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The data retrieved is stored in a cache accessed by the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.GetApplications%2A> and <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.GetObjects%2A> methods as well as the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerPresenceInfo.PresenceStatus%2A> property. The <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe.InternalRefreshData%2A> method only needs to be used if the caller is not subscribed to the specified <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.Peer>, <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe>, or <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact>.
This method blocks additional calls until the network operation is complete and cache has been updated.
The caller is not required to sign in with the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerCollaboration.SignIn%2A> method or via a user interface in to complete this operation successfully.

Docs.exception: The prior RefreshDataAsync call has not yet completed.
